description.narrative:
This project is designed basing on recommendations from the evaluation report. It includes three main components: (i) To inform stakeholders about the transparency and legal loopholes in oil and gas sector using Conoco Philipp as a case study; (ii) PilotEITI model in Quang Tri; and (iii) Promote gender responsive mining in Ha Giang. Related to the first component, under supports from Oxfam Novib, we are conducting research on tax management loopholes basing on Conoco case. In this project, from the Conoco case, we will conduct a research #Transparency in the process of negotiating, signing and implementing oil and gas exploitation contracts in Vietnam, using Conoco Philipp as a case study to generate policy recommendations that will be brought to discuss and inform policy makers.The research will focus on (i) Reviewing the current system of legal documents related to oil and gas exploitation and cooperation activities. Policies and regulatory documents related to the allocation of financial resources from oil and gas exploitation among related parties; (ii) Reviewing the process of developing these contracts and the actual implementation, based on the information that the public can access; (iii) Reaching out to some industry experts or managers to learn about processes and ways of disclosing information during the process of building and negotiating oil and gas contracts and (iv) Comparing the current de factor with de jure process and in the international context as well. . This will complement an on-going efforts supported by Oxfam Novib that would contribute to reform legal framework in tax collection and oil sector. Oxfam implementing partner, VEPR will be developing a detailed TOR for Conoco oil research that will be reviewed by OUS#s Senior Policy Advisor on Tax and Extractive Industries and by the EI regional Program Coordinator. In the second component, with support from Oxfam, EITI pilot has been initiated in Quang Tri province. We have organized several trainings on EITI for multi-stakeholders including Tax Agency, Financial Department, Environmental Department and some mining companies. We have developed EITI framework for Quang Tri. The framework is under consultation process before finalization for implementation. Under this project, wewill continue to support Quang Tri to pilot EITI. This component is directly designed by Quang Tri partners including People#s Council.
In Ha Giang, we have successfully supported Ha Giang Union for Science and Technology to facilitate multi-stakeholderdialogues. Through this mechanism, some community concerns have been positively addressed by local authorities and mining companies. For example, the local authorities allocated budget to improve the road in Minh Son commune;the An Thong company invest their money for dust control in mining area. In this project, we will continue to provide support for reducing negative impacts from mining activities. However, we will focus more on gender issues.
